list_definition.definition: a person who is employed (eg in a hotel, office etc) to answer the telephone, attend to guests, clients etc

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: She works as a hotel receptionist.

list_ex_of_english: Researchers or members of the practice staff, such as receptionists, could also introduce the research.
Initially the receptionists were the ones to say that we have a nurse practitioner 'this is what a nurse practitioner is', because patients don't know.
A wish was expressed that all results should be given in person and only by qualified staff, not by receptionists.
In the case of input, the actor is further restricted to be a receptionist.
Both the set of receptionists and the set of external actors may grow as the configuration evolves.
So the receptionists, once we educated them, they then educated the patients.
Participants included 46 general practitioners, 9 practice managers and 1 receptionist.
It does require extra staff-doctors, a full-time nurse and receptionist; nevertheless the results are encouraging.
